Headline: CEO & Managing Director at Teligenz Tech Solutions Pvt Ltd
Comment:
I have noticed a pattern - that these topics usually get mired in debates around what works and what doesn‚Äôt work, what is good, what is bad, etc.

There are enough people who will vouch for intermittent fasting - whereas there will be others who will vouch for not fasting, and eating small meals multiple times a day.

There are people who will say don‚Äôt eat X, and others who will say, eat only X! And no matter what X is, you will find someone to fight for it!

And there are some, like Warren Buffet who eat burgers and drink Coke - and are fully fit at 90!

For such an important topic, something that impacts everyone, the level of confusion you see, is simply mind boggling!

Invariably, the point that gets lost in all the noise - is that it‚Äôs not about which specific model you adopt. It‚Äôs about the fact that you adopt it fully - not just pick and choose what suits you, what is convenient!

I am sure there will be someone in the planet who will endorse eating ice cream all day, and running a marathon to burn it all off, and swears that it works for them! Don‚Äôt just pick the ice cream, if you aren‚Äôt going to also run the marathon!!

Even with a torn knee muscle I would sit and work out. Consistency builds motivation. Not the other way round.

Headline: Brutally honest as Mirror. Healthiest and Happiest. Head Medical Services, Navi Mumbai International Airport.
Comment:
Dear Dilip, no one wants to die early, thus, as per their understanding and efforts are doing all right things as advised. 
However, eat right, move and sleep well are efforts and not results, akin to all students visiting library don't score high marks, thus results are more important than efforts. 
Yes you may do these things but track results to confirm that you are gaining health. Results to be tracked are: Weight, Blood pressure, Blood sugar, heart rate and lipid profile and watch for positive impact on these parameters vs your healthy habits.
